body_html:
This StackOverflow answer should provide some help.

Basically, you don't need to use PIL. There's an op for decoding PNG files. https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.11/api_docs/python/image.html

Another thing you can do is use ImageMagick on the command line to convert foo.png foo.jpg.
body_text:
This StackOverflow answer should provide some help.
Basically, you don't need to use PIL. There's an op for decoding PNG files. https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.11/api_docs/python/image.html
Another thing you can do is use ImageMagick on the command line to convert foo.png foo.jpg.
body:
This [StackOverflow answer](http://stackoverflow.com/a/34497833) should provide some help.

Basically, you don't need to use PIL. There's an op for decoding PNG files. https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.11/api_docs/python/image.html

Another thing you can do is use ImageMagick on the command line to `convert foo.png foo.jpg`.
